text: This is horrible. We don't talk enough about the aftermath of these tragedies on survivors. The ripple effect is devastating. We need to be vigilant about the mental health effects on those who go through this horror.

text: In DC it's particularly bad. "Where did you go to school" and "What do you do" are the first two things people ask. In my early years here, I would say vaguely "in New York" hoping they'd just assume Columbia or NYU because I was so insecure about not going to a top-tier college.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: It's like the first day of school and finding out you and your bestie are in all the same classes. I'm going to be passing you notes all day.

text: Today's my first day on the politics breaking news desk w/ @WPJohnWagner and @feliciasonmez! Excited to start breaking things together!

text: Can’t speak for the other four, but I’ll miss having you as my deskmate! Though your daily, freshly cut fruit and veggies made me feel a wee insecure about my daily cookie(s) and chocolate intake...

text: Not sure if she’d remember this, but when I was a college journalism intern in DC, @hollybdc was kind enough to have lunch with me to talk about her career. Now, 15 years later, we’re going to be colleagues! Congrats, Holly! Can’t wait to work with you!
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Yes, this. I went to @HofstraU. Was hard to get top internships, but I worked really hard to prove myself. Academic pedigree doesn’t necessarily make someone a better story teller, listener, observer, inquirer...

text: Mom today: They said on the news it’s odd Biden hasn’t announced yet, so maybe he’s not running? Me: He already has national id and can fundraise easily, so he doesn’t really need to get in early. Mom: Why don’t they explain that on TV? Me: Read the Washington Post
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Great piece by @PeggyMcGlone on the draw of the Obama portraits. "A visit to see the portraits seems to be a kind of secular pilgrimage, a journey to witness something both communal and personal."

text: According to Dems, the vote today against Trump's emergency declaration is a vote for democracy itself.

text: I'm currently with my father for a multi-week hospital stay, so yes, I understand the imperative is just to get them to eat. I'm not necessarily talking about what they feed him, though I do wish that was healthier too, I mean the options available for hospital staff and family.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Wow. 32 years. I just can't believe that in 2019, with so much attention on clean eating and nutrition, that we're still eating chicken fingers and fries and soda in hospitals.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Health reporter feature piece idea: Why is hospital cafeteria food so unhealthy? Shouldn't hospitals set an example for health?
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Trapped on a train for 30+ hours: "snack cart on the train is empty and people have run out of diapers for their children." This is giving me so much second-hand anxiety.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Serious question: How do we better educate the public about how we do our work? Courses in journalism as core curriculum in school? No wonder there's a trust gap if a majority of people think we're getting paid off.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Some personal news: Will be covering political breaking news with the great and indefatigable @WPJohnWagner and @feliciasonmez! Couldn't be more thrilled to join this incredible team.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: Trump is trying to say he was successful for getting $1.3B for a barrier ignoring completely that @PeterAlexander noted that he could have gotten $1.6B before the shutdown.

text: Every caveat Trump makes in this speech makes it clear that he pays very close attention to the criticism of him in the press.

text: Wherein I consult the dictionary to determine whether the border is by definition an “emergency.” According to ⁦⁦@MerriamWebster⁩, it’s not.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: "Emergency." A sudden, urgent, usually unexpected occurrence or occasion requiring immediate action. A state, especially of need for help or relief, created by some unexpected event.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: What’s in the 1,169-page border-security bill to avert a government shutdown Via @mikedebonis
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: And here we go. As I wrote last week: "it now seems likely that Trump will sign whatever passes Congress and then move forward on his own." https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/02/07/trump-is-likely-sign-any-border-deal-hes-planning-build-wall-regardless/?utm_term=.916aeda201a6 …

text: On today’s @nytimes The Daily, Parkland kids who were in one of the classrooms say they feel guilty celebrating their birthdays or getting their driver’s license. They’ve been robbed of their teen experience and it’s wrenching.

text: If Trump ultimately signs the border deal, remember I said he would last week. If he doesn't, forget this tweet. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/02/07/trump-is-likely-sign-any-border-deal-hes-planning-build-wall-regardless/?utm_term=.4fe9f0daf169 …

text: In 2009, Transportation Sec. Ray LaHood said high-speed rail would be Obama's legacy. Yesterday, LaHood told me, "It can’t be his legacy if it doesn’t get carried out."
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: I learned the word "mudita" today, which means in Sanskrit, unselfish joy for others' good fortune. I think that's so beautiful and I'm so glad to have a word for when my heart bursts for friends' success and happiness.
author: ColbyItkowitz

text: My take on ⁦@GavinNewsom⁩ decision to scale back high-speed rail in California and why it spells doom for fast trains in America. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/02/13/democratic-governor-just-quashed-democrats-dreams-high-speed-rail-america/ …

text: Yes, that was part of it! The piece from Berlin was a sidebar I wrote to the larger story about America's efforts. In the larger piece I wrote: "Overall, the problems of building and paying for high-speed rail simply outweigh the promise."

text: Wow. I wish I had access to my CQ account to share the magazine story I wrote in 2009 about how true high speed rail was never coming to America.

text: Just because it's going to be really cold this week, does not mean the planet isn't warming overall. In fact, some scientists believe the extreme temperatures are another indication of climate change.

text: This is just awful. Tina is one of the first people in this industry to believe in me and for that I owe her my eternal gratitude. I aspire to be half as good as her. She’s so jaw droppingly talented. Journalism needs her. I hope every outlet fights to get her, mine included.
author: ColbyItkowitz
